I made post about this before but I think nobody was interesting so I'll write it here again: If you want use this wallet as a "Desktop" one then you can install an android emulator like "Nox" on PC, I myself couldn't install Vechain app on my phone because for some reason it doesn't run on Kitkat and even the emulators are running on Kitkat but you can upgrade Nox one. I think this way may be even more secure than a real desktop wallet because if you get infected the virus won't simply find your wallet.dat if it's on your virtual machine.

WRITING.TITLE: How to secure seeds on your computer
WRITING.TEXT: https://truecrypt.ch - make sure the mid5 checks out and don't use TC 7.2 it's a hacked by CIA version. 1. After installing go to Volumes. 2. Create a container. 3. Standard. 4. Select location. 5. AES/Whirpool encryption should be enough. 6. Choose how heavy is your crypto stuff. 7. Choose a complex password . 8. Do as the TC says. 9. Make multiple copies on a USB stick, phone and whatever you like. There are other programs that are constantly updated like Veracrypt. Personally I used Diskcryptor along Truecrypt but someone told me Diskcryptor isn't safe so I dunno. You can also encrypt your whole disk but without a container it won't be reliable because you'll have to decrypt your disk each time you want to use your computer anyway so a container is important, when you'll get a virus the attacker will need your password for the container to get hands on your seeds.

I was at my local library the other day, and I saw Sunny Lu. I went up and said hi to him, with my book in hand, and what he said was startling. "WHY YOU READ THERMODYNAMICS BOOK, ROUND EYES? YOU MUST STUDY BLOCKCHAIN TO CONTRIBUTE TO VERESEARCH. WE GLOBAL BLOCKCHAIN RESEARCH TEAM." At this point I'm just thinking, what the fuck, so I try to play it cool and say, "Blockchain's pretty cool, but engineering is my passion." At this point I could tell he was not happy. He looked straight into my eyes, and immediately did a fierce karate kick into my genitals. So I'm sitting on the floor, rolling around in pain, and the dude starts removing books from the library shelves. He literally rips the barcodes off each one, and starts throwing them at me, repeating for each one: "NOT SECURED BY A GLOBAL LEDGER. NOT SECURED BY A GLOBAL LEDGER." I finally start to get up to run away, and he spits in my face and walks away laughing at the top of his lungs.

I was at my local library the other day, and I saw Sunny Lu. I went up and said hi to him, with my book in hand, and what he said was startling. "WHY YOU READ THERMODYNAMICS BOOK, ROUND EYES?
